title: Wikey
author: Wikey
content: Hi,I’m looking to invest 10k, I’m trying to decide if to go with XRP or ADA. In terms of holding I can do it for 1-3 years no real time limit. Not sure what returns I might get short term vs long term. ADA for example i might get 3 to 4 x return, however with XRP that might be a lot more should they win the court case.My slight worry is what happens if XRP lose. P

comments.author: TheUltraElite
comments.body: If you are personally interested in XRP go for it. A court case will always be in a manner that it helps both parties, so it is upto you to decide, dont be biased about it.While the best option here would be to buy bitcoin with that money, I believe you have made up your mind not to, otherwise you would not be making this question here. So beyond bitcoin, ETH would be the next best option to buy and then LTC and DOGE for long term.Why not divide the money into three parts and see how much each gives you in return, if you are willing to take the risk? Again not financial advice here, you could do something else, but perform this on paper as dummy trading.

comments.author: JeromeTash
comments.created_time: April 14, 2023, 02:41:25 PMLast edit: May 14, 2023, 03:38:31 PM by JeromeTash
comments.body: Just diversify if you aren't decidedMaybe 40% ADA, 30% XRP and 30% for another asset… maybe Doge. This will reduce the risk of you losing out in case something bad happened to XRP. ADA really preformed so well in the last Bull run and I believe it will continue to get a new all-time high in the next one.As for XRP, there was no new all-time high from the one of 2018Look at the charts and see which asset looks good

comments.author: LogitechMouse
comments.body: Quote from: Wikey on April 14, 2023, 01:04:41 PMI’m looking to invest 10k, I’m trying to decide if to go with XRP or ADA. ~My slight worry is what happens if XRP lose. Why not do both? I mean ADA and XRP can give you more than x4 return when the bull market starts, but on the flipside, it might not give you that return in the bull run. I mean anything can happen. If you're only focusing on that 2 coins, just go 50-50 on it. I'm holding ADA personally, but I'm thinking of selling already, and buy Ethereum on it. As for XRP, it didn't come to my mind to hold some of that coins for the long run for some unknown reason. Long term, I think you have a higher chance that you can get x4 returns because it already happened in the past. You are worrying if XRP loses? I guess the community behind Ripple is huge to the point that it will not go down that hard if something bad happens to them. As for ADA, their slow upgrades, and lots of hype is the problem with them, but whenever they release an upgrade to their project, there are little to no bugs or whatever glitches on it. Maybe try on adding some Bitcoin. ADA, XRP, and BTC.

comments.body: We don't know the returns you get now when you start investing in Altcoin XRP and you for 1-3 full years to be honest it's not easy to predict and I think it's hard to find accurate pricing as a calculation of three years profit in those two altcoins, I think if they have a staking service on these two coins maybe I would advise you more if you think that for long term investments so that your coins get more returns apart from selling coins you get paid for the staking you do.So far, XRP is clearer in determining victory in this case, but I don't really understand why this is taking so long and it continues to take quite a long time, but if XRP wins, you will probably win more than the price you will get on XRP.

comments.author: electronicash
comments.body: XRP had not hit its ATH since 2017 but ADA did. but they are both just crazy tokens that will also be dumped to its knees every bear market so holding it up to 3 years will not be the best way of doing it. you wanna sell it while the price is high. you do not wait for the price to dip after 3 months after BTC hits ATH again. most probably altcoins are the first to be dumped.

comments.author: fzkto
comments.body: I would not invest all in one project. Although if I had to choose between ADA or XRP, I would choose ADA. Ripple has performed very poorly in the last bull market. And it seems to me that the sec lawsuit has nothing to do with it. XRP has a huge issue, and there is no telling how many coins the developers are selling on the market to those willing to buy. Most likely because of the large sales the price couldn't hit the last ATH. To me that says a lot.

At least put some in the other basket 'cause it's either a loss or a win depending on how you will gonna play with your investment.
